summary:
There was one answer that I appreciated — even while not trying to be biased or judgmental — and it goes:

“I do express to know if I’m fooling myself or if the other person feels something too.”

Trust me, this can save young girls and emotionally invested women from a lot of sadness that could come from heartbreaks or one-sided love. One respondent put it powerfully:

“Love can be unconditional, but relationships are a bit conditional — they’re about walking together, adjusting, surviving.”

Love was also described as comfort, companionship, and emotional safety. Some women are noticeably head over heels, as their response said:

“I might have had high standards set for my partner, but you make it look like it’s the bare minimum.”

Others said:

“I love you more than I could ever try and express.”. Emotional intimacy is a key foundation of a healthy relationship — it builds trust, provides emotional security, relieves stress, and can ultimately make or break the relationship, forming the base of love itself. They need to understand that women are not challenging them when they are admitting that they are not interested in the relationship moving forward.”

What advice would you give your younger self (or another girl) about love and relationships?
